job_title: Emergency Room Technician in Klamath Falls, OR
pros: Great emergency room Physicians to work with and learn from. Great place to get pt contacts.ER director is amazing. Amazing new RN staff that brings a great attitude of team work and bringing a great sense of caring to the local community. Able to talk to upper management about issues. Great team atmosphere with peers.
cons: Pay is one of the lowest in the state for emergency room technician. Medical assistant, unit clerk, and registration clerk has a higher pay scale. Charge nurses that are unwilling to learn new ways they are also set in there ways. Some Floor management(charge RN) are unwilling to learn about different management styles “it should be the way that I say it is, it isn’t that hard.” Unable to communicate Affectively to charge nurses.

job_title: Staff RN in Klamath Falls, OR
pros: great doctor and some great nurses
cons: sky lakes ER is a horrible place to work there management bullies you, threatens you and does everything to get you to quit if they don't like you. if they can't get you to quit they will find reasons to try to get you in trouble for stupid ridiculous things. They have charge nurses that shop on line and play on the computer all night and take a ton of smoke breaks all night instead of working. techs and RN"s that sit and talk all night and play with there phones instead of working. When you complain to management about it they throw it in your face and nothing is done about it. Management lets the staff they like do anything they like including not working. this could be the reason all night shift RNs are new RN,S and there is only 1 nurse at night that has been there more than 2 years. most of the ER is ran by travels because no one wants to work there. The ER is ran like a high school. you have to be part of the in crowd with management or they make your life miserable

job_title: Registered Nurse in Klamath Falls, OR
pros:
The pay is great, especially in relation to the low cost of living here. 

There is a nurses union here.
cons: Management from lower level through VP level is a sham. Too many people just buying time until retirement and they refuse to hear valid concerns about unsafe physician practices from negligent physicians - physicians who were also hired just to fill a spot. If you tell them, even tactfully, about any concerns they pretend to care to get you to speak openly and then deflect the issue back to you. Then they will say you are confrontational or hysterical, or that you are “picking on” the physician. All while making sure to tell you not to file a quality control report which is suppose to provide transparency and accountability when something unsafe occurs, because “they’ll deal with it off the record.” Of course, they never do though. They employ too many doctors who seem to have given up practicing medicine and just don’t care. Getting orders on a crashing patient is almost useless as the doctors don’t want to be bothered. Small area with not enough healthcare providers to handle the growing population. Being the only hospital in town, they will absolutely “black-ball” you to any other departments, both inpatient and outpatient, and I have witnessed this happen to more than one good employee.

review_title: Run as fast as you can
job_title: Respiratory Therapist in Klamath Falls, OR
pros: There are none, they lure you in have you buy a place and then they work on getting rid of you. It's fabulous!
cons: Extremely high infection rate that they keep secret, their labratory has equipment that gives wrong values, a high death rate. It just goes on. They have been sued lots, they have residents that run amuck and they have bought nearly all clinics in town and now are working on putting out of bussiness the rest. If your Morman life is good, if not your out at the drop of the hat or your part of the good old boy system. They even have employees working that have alzheimers. They hire new grads to pay low wages and get rid of senior professionals. All hospitals have problems but this one takes the cake, never seen nothing like it. They take full advantage of being 100 miles from nowhere, they love to ruin lives as well. Ive never seen so many depressed people before. As soon as I can go I'm out of here!

job_title: CNA/Monitor Tech in Klamath Falls, OR

cons: The hospital is ne of the largest employers in our city.The management does not listen to the non-union employees needs including sexual harassment.   Unfortunately while employees continue to be laid off, the CEO wages continue to rise, he is one of the highest paid on the west coast. This is a very poor area. Rather than hiring nurses that graduate from OIT that live here, graduates who will leve w/in 2 years arw hired to keep down labor cost.

review_title: Should have gone with my gut instincts. Never, never work there.....
job_title: R N in Klamath Falls, OR
pros: OK pay. Much of the Staff including Dr's are nice.  Hospital itself seems ok as far as hospitals go.  The people are friendly and helpful in the town itself.
cons:
1. Learn not to make waves or question policies, behaviours or be brave enough to think outside the box. 
2. Management treats  plenty of staff poorly unless your part of the "In Crowd" then they somehow create new jobs that leave many of us scratching our heads....saying what the heck do they exactly do??  
3. Management professes  to treat all employees well and without favoritism. Sure. 
3.Leadership is more like the Natzi brownshirts.  They know they own this town and even most of the community knows the same.

job_title: Physical Therapist in Klamath Falls, OR
pros: Quality over productivity emphasized, so helps reduce day-to-day work stress and make you feel like a valued employee. Everyone I've encountered so far is friendly and willing to help. The facilities are nice and overall has a relaxed feel compared to other hospitals. The hospital does a lot to involve itself in the community and support the community.
cons: The cafeteria is really small and food selection is just OK; would be nice if they had an outdoor area outside the cafeteria to eat for employees on a nice day. Parking is also an issue, but being worked on.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Klamath Falls, OR

cons: Many employees who have been at this hospital 15-30 yrs.  who have never worked anywhere else and take this hospital for granted and fall into the complaining and negative attitudes with a lot of back bitting and putting down other nurses.

job_title: CNA in Klamath Falls, OR
